bug.author: jfelectron
bug.summary: LightningModule does not subclass from torch.nn.Module which breaks depedency injection of models
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Pytorch requires very specific ordering of init and self assignment of module submodels: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L39>https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L39</denchmark-link>
Lighting appears to break this expectation in ways that aren't documented and hard to understand, resulting in: AttributeError: cannot assign module before Module.init() call It's not clear why but based on the documentation, it seems like LightningModule should subclass from torch.nn.Module

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jfelectron>@jfelectron</denchmark-link> lightning does subclass from nn.Module... I think you forgot to call super().() before doing anything in your class.
This error happened with me once and i had forgotten to call super().init()
